title: Asia‚Äôs Coal Imports Dip as China and India Cut Purchases
summary: Asia‚Äôs imports of thermal coal by sea slipped by nearly 8% in July from a year earlier, as a rebound in Japanese and South Korean purchases couldn‚Äôt offset declines in top importers China and India, which have boosted domestic supply and stockpiles in recent months. Asian seaborne coal imports fell
fullContent: Asia‚Äôs imports of thermal coal by sea slipped by nearly 8% in July from a year earlier, as a rebound in Japanese and South Korean purchases couldn‚Äôt offset declines in top importers China and India, which have boosted domestic supply and stockpiles in recent months. Asian seaborne coal imports fell by 7.8% in July compared to July 2024, data compiled by commodity analysts Kpler and cited by Reuters columnist Clyde Russell showed on Tuesday. Coal shipments into Asia declined by 8.4% in the January-July period compared to the first‚Ä¶

These Are The World's 50 Most Valuable Private Companies
summary: These Are The World's 50 Most Valuable Private Companies div property="schema:text" class="clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summ
fullContent: These Are The World's 50 Most Valuable Private Companies The race to build the next generation of global giants is on. While public markets get most of the spotlight, private companies are quietly building massive valuations and shaping the future of industries. This visualization, via Visual Capitalist's Marcus Lu, ranks the world‚Äôs 50 most valuable private companies in 2025, highlighting emerging powerhouses from different countries and sectors. Data & Discussion The data for this visualization comes from CB Insights. It ranks private companies globally by their most recent reported valuations. Rank Company Country Valuation ($B) 1 üöÄ SpaceX United States $350 2 üì± ByteDance China $300 3 üß† OpenAI United States $300 4 üí≥ Stripe United States $70 5 üëó SHEIN Singapore $66 6 üìä Databricks United States $62 7 ü§ñ Anthropic United States $62 8 üåå xAI United States $50 9 üí± Revolut United Kingdom $45 10 üé® Canva Australia $32 11 üèà Fanatics United States $31 12 üõ°Ô∏è Safe Superintelligence United States $30 13 üè¶ Chime United States $25 14 üéÆ Epic Games United States $23 15 üß≠ Miro United States $18 16 üì∏ Xiaohongshu China $17 17 üßæ Rippling United States $17 18 üìö Yuanfudao China $16 19 üì∑ DJI Innovations China $15 20 üí¨ Discord United States $15 21 üõçÔ∏è Gopuff United States $15 22 ü•§ Yuanqi Senlin China $15 23 üí∏ Ripple United States $15 24 üõí Klarna Sweden $15 25 üõ∞Ô∏è Anduril United States $14 26 üß™ Scale United States $14 27 üåä OpenSea United States $13 28 ‚öôÔ∏è Celonis Germany $13 29 üíº Ramp United States $13 30 ‚úçÔ∏è Grammarly United States $13 31 ‚ù§Ô∏è Devoted Health United States $13 32 üåç Deel United States $13 33 üõí Faire United States $13 34 üè¢ Brex United States $12 35 üö¨ JUUL Labs United States $12 36 ü™ô Bitmain Technologies China $12 37 üå± GoodLeap United States $12 38 üß∫ Xingsheng Selected China $12 39 üìã Airtable United States $12 40 üöó ZongMu Technology China $11 41 üåê Global Switch United Kingdom $11 42 üí≥ Checkout.com United Kingdom $11 43 ‚ö° Bolt United States $11 44 üîÆ Alchemy United States $10 45 üß¨ Colossal United States $10 46 üöõ Huolala China $10 47 üß† Thinking Machines Lab United States $10 48 üë• Gusto United States $10 49 üöò Chehaoduo China $10 50 üìû Talkdesk United States $10 Note: Scale AI‚Äôs recent deal with Meta was not captured in the source dataset. Scale is now valued at roughly $29 billion, which would place it 14th in this ranking. Artificial Intelligence is Taking Over AI startups are increasingly populating the top 10, with OpenAI in third ($300 billion), Anthropic in seventh ($62 billion), and xAI in eighth ($50 billion). All three of these companies have produced some of the world‚Äôs smartest AI models in recent years. Further down the ranking, we can identify Safe Superintelligence ($30 billion), which was created by former employees of OpenAI and Anthropic, and Scale AI, in which Meta recently acquired a 49% stake. This deal wasn‚Äôt captured in the source dataset, but it means that Scale is now valued at $29 billion, which would bump it up to 14th place. Finally, there are many companies that have AI applications, but not necessarily as their core product. This includes names like Databricks (a data analytics platform), Grammarly (uses generative AI to power its writing assistant), and Colossal (a de-extinction biotech company). If you enjoyed today‚Äôs post, check out History‚Äôs Most Valuable Companies vs the Magnificent 7 on Voronoi, the new app from Visual Capitalist. Tyler Durden Tue, 08/05/2025 - 05:45
